snippet: Johnson & Johnson said Friday that it would add about $600 million to its reserves to cover a possible settlement of allegations that it paid kickbacks to a company that dispenses drugs to nursing homes.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson announces that it will add about $600 million to its reserves to cover a possible settlement of allegations that it paid kickbacks to Omnicare, a company that dispenses drugs to nursing homes.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson said Friday that it would add about $600 million to its reserves to cover a possible settlement of allegations that it paid kickbacks to a company that dispenses drugs to nursing homes.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Reserves Funds for Settlement
headline.print_headline: Johnson & Johnson Reserves Funds For Settlement
